In your form object:
```
@implementation ProductSelectionForm


(NSDictionary *)productList
{
    return @{FXFormFieldOptions: @[@"Juice", @"Water", @"Coffee"],
             FXFormFieldAction: @"productListChanged"};
}


(NSDictionary )productOptionsField
{
    NSMutableDictionary details = [NSMutableDictionary dictionary];
    details[FXFormFieldOptions] = @[@"Option1", @"Option2", @"Option3"];
    if (self.productList == Coffee)
    {
        //only allow single-selection
        return @{FXFormFieldType: FXFormFieldTypeInteger}
    }
    else
    {
        //allow multi-selection
        return @{FXFormFieldType: FXFormFieldTypeBitfield}
    }
    return details;
}  


@end
```
And in your view controller:
```
@implementation ProductSelectionFormViewController

(void)productListChanged
{
    self.formController.form = self.productSelectionForm;
    [self.tableView reloadData];
}

@end
```
Hope that makes sense.

. @mrs1987 Looking at your specific problem, I think here's how you should solve it:
In your form object:
```
@implementation ProductSelectionForm


(NSDictionary *)productList
{
    return @{FXFormFieldOptions: @[@"Juice", @"Water", @"Coffee"],
             FXFormFieldAction: @"productListChanged"};
}


(NSDictionary )productOptionsField
{
    NSMutableDictionary details = [NSMutableDictionary dictionary];
    details[FXFormFieldOptions] = @[@"Option1", @"Option2", @"Option3"];
    if (self.productList == Coffee)
    {
        //only allow single-selection
        return @{FXFormFieldType: FXFormFieldTypeInteger}
    }
    else
    {
        //allow multi-selection
        return @{FXFormFieldType: FXFormFieldTypeBitfield}
    }
    return details;
}  


@end
```
And in your view controller:
```
@implementation ProductSelectionFormViewController

(void)productListChanged
{
    self.formController.form = self.productSelectionForm;
    [self.tableView reloadData];
}

@end
```
Hope that makes sense.
Note, this will only work if you have 3 options in your productOptions field (as you do in your example). If you have 4 options, option 4 would have an enum value of 4 when it's in bitfield mode and 3 when it's in single-selection mode so it wouldn't quite work unless a different approach is used.
